events.name: Encore Karaoke Lounge, Luvs!
events.description:
Coach Mo here to tell you that YOU can do this, you will do this, consider it done! Sing with us dance with us it's going to be fun!
Erika and Shavon apparently went WITHOUT ME to Encore and reported back with some serious 5 star ratings.
*peers over at Erika and Shavon*
And I'm not hurt, they did the legwork and their research is darned solid. Hmph! ;)

Our karaoke scientists returned with some notes. Take note!

Rules from Encore:

♡Tip the KJ, always

♡ (1) One-drink minimum

♡Don't bring in any drinks

♡$60 clean-up non-refundable fee if we bring food. A.k.a. NO FOOD.

♡When your name is called for your song, you can then request another song??? Ok I guess.

♡The rest is pretty logical..their rules:
class=

>https://encorekaraokesf.com/etiquette

Taking a quote straight from Encore:

Well, ok! I'm there. Also I'm dead tired that day from teaching and I will be sounding like a seal singing Kiss from a Rose. Speaking of which, how about a duet or group project with that song?

This is your time. You will join us and then afterwards sit back at home and muse
You will do this, you can do this, consider it done!
class=

>https://encorekaraokesf.com/songbook

Greetings fab super awesome spiffy strong Karaoke Person! See you soon. Any duet or group requests? Let us know! Songbook:
class=
>https://encorekaraokesf.com/songbook
events.how_to_find_us: Cross Streets: Polk & Larkin St. Go to the 2nd Floor. Look for the people looking like they're looking for people from a Meetup. You know that look, it says,
I'll have a Meetup sign hopefully.

events.name: Our Monthly Performance and Potluck
events.description:
Bay Area Music Circle performance and potluck location will be at David A's house.

If you wish to perform for our concert, which starts at 5:00 pm, please sign up here:
class=

>https://goo.gl/HgfXBz

When coming to our potluck:

* Please bring a dish large enough to share with others.

* If you would like to play music, please bring your instrument and music to perform/jam with others (we have pianists who can sight read well and are happy to accompany singers/instrumentalists)

* Please be supportive of all performers, be a part of our circle, have fun, and make friends!

events.name: Instrument/Voice/Percussion Circle @ Reed's Recordings

events.description:
Beginning/Intermediate instrument/voice/percussion circle.
Guidelines:
-Safety through positive feedback.
-Creativity by discovery.
-With some beginners, expect less-than-perfect rhythms & tones.
-Organizer or current activity's conductor guides others.
We'll be at this music studio:
class=

>https://www.reedsrecordings.com/
Address: 1334 Dell Ave, Suite F, Campbell, CA 95008
Phone:[masked]
We'll be starting with basic melodic warmups, then expanding gradually into jams, taking frequent breaks in between for feedback and check-in. We'll also be turning down the lights to tune in the music we're making more.
Bring your favorite instruments and percussion.

events.name: Paul Sprawl at Dala's Nest House Concerts (DNHC), May 19th, 7-9pm! $15

group.name: South Bay House Concerts - SF2SJ music connect

events.description:
Venue details follow Artist Info

ARTIST INFO
Paul Sprawl has enjoyed a full-time music career since Sept. 1997. He plays all over North America and in Europe. He has nine full-length recordings of his own songs (to date), the first on a German label and the others independently produced. He's also produced three full-length CDs for other artists.

Born and raised in California, he and his wife are currently building a place for artists to find refuge and inspiration in Big Bend, Texas. Playing guitar, singing and writing songs since he was a boy, his music uniquely combines percussive (hammer) guitar techniques with bottleneck, tapping, harmonica, and a rich baritone voice.

Whether documentaries of real world characters met traveling, flights of guitar fascination, or detailed cinematic inspiration, Sprawl's songs come from a lifelong far, wide, and deep creative process. His sensibility is that of a world traveler grown from a kid schooled in Southern California in the 60's and 70's film and music culture. The scope of his songwriting breaks barriers with a complex, intricate, sound linking our humanity with his thoughtfully crafted lyrics. He gives voice to outsiders of the world and captures full, intimate moments with his poetic (yet incisive) style.

More info and links to music at...
class=

>https://www.ListeningRoomNetwork.com/event-acampbell20180519.html

VENUE DETAILS
~ RSVPs confirmed/waitlist closed 2 days before the event.
~ Address provided to confirmed guests prior to the show.
(Menlo Park, Willows neighborhood)
Gate opens at 6:30pm; seating is first-come, first choice.
There's an organic garden to explore after you've chosen your seat.
Wear layers for comfort (RAIN moves Garden gigs into the Cottage).
~ A suggested $15 donation will be collected at the door.
~ Dala's Nest is nestled among heritage oaks and redwoods and is hidden
from the street; look for venue signs posted just before door/gate time.
~ ABUNDANT, free, street parking (DRIVEWAY is a FIRELANE - do not use).
~ If you like, BYOB/snacks. Dala's Nest is a longtime patron of nearby Cafe
Zoe and La Hacienda Market/Taqueria (next to each other on Menalto x
Gilbert) and we visit often for delicious, inexpensive, fresh food.
~ Dala's Nest values a chill vibe, therefore *NO PETS or SMOKING* for
guest comfort and the environment (service animals allowed only with
Host's pre-approval; mention request with your RSVP, if needed).
~ Powder room available from door/gate time to close.
events.how_to_find_us: Dala's Nest is nestled among heritage oaks and redwoods, and is hidden from the street. Signs are posted at curb & entrance just before /door/gate time. There's abundant, free, STREET parking for guests (driveway is a FIRELANE; please KEEP CLEAR).

events.name: Tyr, Orphaned Land, Ghost Ship Octavius, Aeternam
Dirty Cello and Lisa Lindsley at the Piedmont Center for the Arts
events.description:
An evening of jazz and blues, with a sprinkling of bluegrass and wild gypsy music from Dirty Cello. Special guest performance by Jazz vocalist Lisa Lindsley.
From China to Italy, and all over the USA, Dirty Cello brings the world a high energy and unique spin on blues and bluegrass. Led by vivacious cross-over cellist Rebecca Roudman, Dirty Cello is cello like you’ve never heard before. From down home blues with a wailing cello to virtuosic stompin’ bluegrass, Dirty Cello is a band that gets your heart thumping and your toes tapping!
Oakland-based jazz vocalist Lisa Lindsley has been called a glass of champagne, cool, refreshing, and a little bubbly. Living and creating on two continents, America and Europe, is not always easy, but is always fun. Lindsley invites listeners to surrender to her smoky soprano, while her vocal command and deft timing assure they will be delighted they did.

Tickets available:
class=
>https://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/3334927

events.name: Third Saturday Evening at La Promenade Cafe
events.description:
We're meeting again in May at La Promenade Cafe. We'll be using The Daily Ukulele (the Yellow Book) and The Daily Ukulele Leap Year Edition (the Blue Book). Please bring BOTH books, your instrument(s), a floor or table music stand, your singing voices, and your fabulous ukulele spirit!

We'll begin with this short playlist of songs from The Daily Ukulele Leap Year Edition (the Blue Book).

Jamaica Farewell, p. 199
Hello Mary Lou, p. 135
Sweet Someone, p. 333
The M.T.A., p. 259
Sway, p. 336
Monday Monday, p. 250
Beyond The Reef, p. 33

By request:
>>Blue Book:
Five Hundred Miles, p.121
Ferry ‘Cross The Mersey, p.117
Exactly Like You, p.113
Everybody’s Talkin’, p.112
Elenor, p.108 (most difficult)

Please post additional songs you'd like to play in the comments. When we've finished the playlist, we'll take turns picking songs to play from the Yellow and Blue books. You can also brings songs not in either of these books; just please bring enough copies to share.

events.name: OFFICIAL DATE: Farmer's Market Performance: The Return

group.name: The San Jose Pop Up Choir

events.description:
THIS IS ME & YOU WILL BE FOUND

PLEASE NOTE: We are meeting at Eagle Park at the corner of Church and Franklin. There are two parking lots available - We will practice our songs and then head over to perform.

Yes, is has been a couple of years since we started to venture out into the real world and sing and run - but as our name is Pop Up, it is time to do just that. Mark your calendars as we will be doing some POP UP magic at a Farmer's Market in Mountain View.

Lunch will follow for those that want to hang out, suggesting Hangen Szechuan Restaurant across from the Farmer’s Market.

Hope you can make it.
events.how_to_find_us: We are meeting at Eagle Park at the corner of Church and Franklin. There are two parking lots available - see you there at 10am.

events.name: Claudia Villela at The Chimes
events.description: Regretfully, Jackie Ryan had to cancel the concert, but fortunately Claudia Villela is available to step in. If you haven't had your Brazilian jazz fix this year, this is the Brazilian-born vocalist to start with. Checkout the videos on her web site. Typical of our group, we'll socialize at lunch a few blocks away then walk to the concert.

---Phil Elwood, San Francisco Examiner

[Press release] Jazz at the Chimes is an independently produced concert series that features Bay Area musicians. Concerts are held in the stunning architectural landmark Chimes Chapel, designed by Julia Morgan at the turn of the 20th century. The chapel provides a stunning visual backdrop and wonderful acoustic listening venue for live music. The series is sponsored by Chapel of the Chimes located at 4499 Piedmont Avenue, Oakland, CA.
class=

>https://www.claudiavillela.com/videos

Ticket: General $15.00 ($16.52 w/service fee) no refunds or purchase at the door. https:/brownpaperticket.com

I'll post the lunch location later. In-line for lunch at 11:45a to socialize with the members then take a short walk to the Chapel around 1:15, show starts at 2:00. Meetup is a social organization, not an activity calendar. Please do not RSVP unless you're having lunch to meet members. Lunch can mean just a beverage and appetizer or meal. You're required to have a clear photo so that we can recognize you. Details to the final group.
class=
>http://www.jazzatthechimes.com/home
events.how_to_find_us: In-line for lunch at 11:45a; in-line at Chimes 1:15; Concert starts 2:00

events.name: Livermore Valley Ukulele Club May 2018 Spring Uke Jam
events.description:
We will be hosting our next uke jam at Casse Croute Bakery. Bring your uke, a music stand. The jam will be led by talented singer and ukulele player, Joe Galang. Enjoy a bakery treat, some coffee and let's jam! Note: Only 20 spots available! Please only RSVP if you are sure you are coming and if you do RSVP and can't make it, please update your RSVP. We count on the the RSVP's to make sure we have enough seating.

Also, if you haven't already, please look for

on Facebook and request to be added to the group page.

We will have a donations jar to cover operations costs.

He plays a variety of pop, classic rock, and country covers and originals, and has previously shared the stage with acts such as Natalie Stovall, the Tim Reynolds Trio (TR3) and Leon Russell.

events.name: 420-Friendly Backyard Acoustic Jam Session
events.description:
Grab your favorite acoustic instrument(s) and join us on the patio for a 420-friendly acoustic jam session. The house is a .08-mile walk from the San Leandro BART Station or a .25-mile walk from the nearest bus stop. There's plenty of parking in the neighborhood. BYOB&B (bring your own buds & beverages) and if you like, bring some munchies to share. You must be 21 or older to attend.

The address will be shared upon RSVP.

events.name: Sufi Whirling Workshop

group.name: SF Bay Area Music & Sound Healing Group

events.description:
Learn the basic technique of Sufi whirling (Iranian and Turkish style), history, and theory. Farima’s teachings are based o ancient Iranic rituals, science of whirling, and the sacred geometry of whirling. We will learn essential techniques of whirling preparation, maintaining balance and posture, controlling dizziness, self-focus during turning, breath work, and more.

For this workshop please wear comfortable clothing, whirling skirt (optional), socks or soft-soled shoes. Avoid eating a large meal 2 hours prior.
class=

>https://www.eventbrite.com/e/dance-of-the-soul-sufi-whirling-workshop-gathering-tickets-45226576909?utm-medium=discovery&utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&aff=escb&utm-source=cp&utm-term=listing
Or you can just show up

About Farima
Farima Berenji – MA, PhDc, CID-UNESCO
Founder and Artistic Director, Worldwide Simorgh Dance Collective, 2007
Founder and Director of the Awakening and Lioness Project (Ancient Iranic Warrior Dances and Rituals, 2013)

-FMI about Farima Berenji visit
class=

>http://farimadance.com/

Farima Berenji is an award winning Dance Ethnologist and internationally acclaimed dance artist, choreographer, instructor, and Sufi dance master. Recognized and certified as one of the few world scholarly experts of ancient and mystical Iranian dance ethnology by UNESCO, she travels worldwide to record, research, lecture, perform, educate, and to inspire dynamic creativity and rejuvenation through dance and movement. She is a Magi (Iranian Shaman Master) and a Sufi.

Farima has worked as a UN scholar, researching and led an excavations team of Iranian archeology emphasizing the preservation of ancient and mystical Iranic dances. Farima’s dance and spiritual training spans years of intensive research with master artists, scholars, and spiritual teachers worldwide. She comes from the Sufi Order of Yarsan of Iran and has devoted her life into researching and brining back the ancient Sufi traditions of Iran and the origin of Sema (Khorasan Sema).

Farima teaches her own original research findings, methods, techniques, and exercises to uncover the connection between the soul and dance movements based on the book she is writing ‘Seven Sema’ the connection of human soul and the 7 sacred elements of life.

As a scholar, Farima presents new archaeological discoveries and research upon Sufism and its connection to the ancient Zoroastrianism and Sufism, the human body, and its symbolic meaning in the Universe along the pathway to the soul. She will introduce you to ritual movements celebrating the grace and joy of life and to a society where and when people lived in harmony with each other and with nature. She teaches her own unique movement and techniques that are researched and inspired during her various studies in Khaneqas (Sufi Houses) and Fire temples of Khorasan, Kurdistan, Tehran, and Shiraz.

Farima is one of the few Iranian women who has been allowed to teach, write and perform the Gwati and Vahishta Sema Rituals in Iran and around the world and has been recognized by Iran and UN as the pioneer of bringing back the original mystic Rituals of Khorasan. She is the first Iranian woman to have received the CID-UNESCO award and certification and is currently the dance ambassador of UNESCO, the first Iranian woman artist to receive the National Folk Dance Association award, and the first Iranian woman healer and dancer to have been chosen for TED Talk. Farima is the recipient of the prestigious UN award and has been recognized by Congressman Mike Honda, by the Iranian Women's Rights Committee “30 Voices,” Music and Cultural Organization of Turkey. Farima was the first Iranian, to have been invited and perform during a reception for US President Obama, Governor of Alaska, UN, EU, Ambassador of Canada, and Ambassador of Spain.
